C

Client - Class in main.java.peer
Client class creates client to index server

Client Driver is the main program on the peer to obtain and return files

D

deregister(String) - Method in class main.java.peer.Client

G

Store all the file names of a given directory
getNeighbors(String) - Method in class main.java.peer.Client

M

main(String[]) - Static method in class main.java.peer.ClientDriver
Main function creates client to server, and initiates peer server Input is IP address of host and the directory that the peer will share and download to
main.java.peer - package main.java.peer
 

O

obtain(String) - Method in class main.java.peer.PeerImpl
Pass chunks of the file to the clients remote peer object until the file is written

P

Server part of the Peer

Constructor for exporting each peer to the registry
PeerInt - Interface in main.java.peer
Interface for peer data transfer methods

Q

query(Pair<String, Integer>, int, String) - Method in class main.java.peer.PeerImpl
Query a peer for a file, this query propagates until the time-to-live reaches 0
query(Pair<String, Integer>, int, String) - Method in interface main.java.peer.PeerInt
 
queryhit(Pair<String, Integer>, String, String, int) - Method in class main.java.peer.PeerImpl
A Query hit is propagated back to the original peer to request a file so a direct file request may begin
queryhit(Pair<String, Integer>, String, String, int) - Method in interface main.java.peer.PeerInt
 
queryNeighbors(String, int, Pair<String, Integer>) - Method in class main.java.peer.PeerImpl
Query all of this peers neighbors for a file

R

register(String) - Method in class main.java.peer.Client

W

WatchDir - Class in main.java.peer
Watches a directory (or tree) for changes to files.
